title: DOJ Voter Data Request Communications (secretary of state)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

From January 20, 2025 to the present:

1. All correspondence, emails, letters, and written communications between the agency and the U.S. Department of Justice, including but not limited to the Civil Rights Division, the Office of the Attorney General, and the Executive Office for Immigration Review, relating to voter registration data, voter files, voter rolls, or voter list maintenance.

2. All internal communications within the agency (including emails, memoranda, and briefing materials) discussing, referencing, or responsive to any DOJ request for voter registration data or any proposed or executed memorandum of understanding with the DOJ regarding voter data.

3. Any lists, spreadsheets, databases, or other records received from the DOJ identifying specific voters for removal, investigation, or further review.

4. All records relating to the engagement of any third-party contractor in connection with DOJ voter data requests or voter list maintenance activities conducted pursuant to any agreement with the DOJ.

If any records are withheld in whole or in part, please identify the specific statutory exemption relied upon for each withholding.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Audrey Nielsen

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: DOJ Voter Data Request Communications (secretary of state)
communications.communication:
Hello, 

Please find the request form attached. Thank you for your help with this request. 

Sincerely, 
MuckRock

title: DOJ Voter Data Request Communications (Lt. Governor's office)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Government Records Access and Management Act, I hereby request the following records:

From January 20, 2025 to the present:

1. All correspondence, emails, letters, and written communications between the agency and the U.S. Department of Justice, including but not limited to the Civil Rights Division, the Office of the Attorney General, and the Executive Office for Immigration Review, relating to voter registration data, voter files, voter rolls, or voter list maintenance.

2. All internal communications within the agency (including emails, memoranda, and briefing materials) discussing, referencing, or responsive to any DOJ request for voter registration data or any proposed or executed memorandum of understanding with the DOJ regarding voter data.

3. Any lists, spreadsheets, databases, or other records received from the DOJ identifying specific voters for removal, investigation, or further review.

4. All records relating to the engagement of any third-party contractor in connection with DOJ voter data requests or voter list maintenance activities conducted pursuant to any agreement with the DOJ.

If any records are withheld in whole or in part, please identify the specific statutory exemption relied upon for each withholding.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

title: DOJ Voter Data Request Communications (Michigan Secretary of State)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: DOJ Voter Data Request Communications (Michigan Secretary of State)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

From January 20, 2025 to the present:

1. All correspondence, emails, letters, and written communications between the agency and the U.S. Department of Justice, including but not limited to the Civil Rights Division, the Office of the Attorney General, and the Executive Office for Immigration Review, relating to voter registration data, voter files, voter rolls, or voter list maintenance.

2. All internal communications within the agency (including emails, memoranda, and briefing materials) discussing, referencing, or responsive to any DOJ request for voter registration data or any proposed or executed memorandum of understanding with the DOJ regarding voter data.

3. Any lists, spreadsheets, databases, or other records received from the DOJ identifying specific voters for removal, investigation, or further review.

4. All records relating to the engagement of any third-party contractor in connection with DOJ voter data requests or voter list maintenance activities conducted pursuant to any agreement with the DOJ.

If any records are withheld in whole or in part, please identify the specific statutory exemption relied upon for each withholding.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Audrey Nielsen

The MDOS FOIA System application link will be available the next time you log in.

If you are facing any issues, please use Help Page link (https://milogin.michigan.gov/uisecure/selfservice/anonymous/help) to contact the help desk for further assistance.

communications.subject: Request Created - CR-14027
communications.communication: Request 14027 has been created. The status of request 14027 can be tracked by visiting the Records Request Portal. An initial response to request 14027 will be received within five business days. The Department may extend the time for responding to a request by an additional 10 business days by notifying the requesting person in writing of the reason for the extension and the new due date as described at MCL 15.235(2)(d) and (6).
